QuestionGroup.Description: Ask the patient these questions, an answer of 'no' to each question scores one point.~~Start by asking the patient to remember the following 3 objects: Key, Lemon, Balloon

Question.Name: Patient have problems with judgment (e.g. falls for scams, bad financial decisions, buys gifts inappropriate for recipients)
Patient has reduced interest in hobbies/activities
Patient often repeats questions, stories or statements
Patient has trouble learning how to use a tool, appliance or gadget (e.g. VCR, computer, microwave, remote control)
Question.Symptom: Trouble learning using tool, appliance or gadget

Question.Name: Patient often forgets correct month or year
Patient has difficulties when handling complicated financial affairs (e.g. balancing checkbook, income taxes, paying bills)
Question.Symptom: Difficulties when handling complicated financial affairs

Question.Name: Patient has difficulty with remembering appointments
Patient encounters consistent problems with thinking and/or memory
Question.Symptom: Consistent problems with thinking and/or memory

Question.Name: Can the patient copy the intersecting pentagon as shown below
Can the patient recall the word Key?
Can the patient recall the word Lemon
Can the patient recall the word Balloon
